generatedTitle: why did settlers fence off their land

extractFactDictList.question: When was fencing used to keep livestock in and wild animals out?
extractFactDictList.sentence: In the early days of settlement, fencing was also used to keep livestock in and wild animals out.

extractFactDictList.question: How many reasons did settlers need to fence off their land?
extractFactDictList.sentence: One of the primary reasons why settlers needed to fence off their land was to establish ownership.

extractFactDictList.question: When was land often claimed through the process of "squatting"?
extractFactDictList.sentence: In the early days of settlement, land was often claimed through the process of "squatting," which involved settling on land without official permission.

extractFactDictList.question: When were there legal protections in place to prevent people from taking what they wanted?
extractFactDictList.sentence: In the early days of settlement, there were often no legal protections in place to prevent people from taking what they wanted.

extractFactDictList.question: When was livestock an important source of food and income for settlers?
extractFactDictList.sentence: In the early days of settlement, livestock was an important source of food and income for settlers.
